cause.description:
TAPS provides ongoing emotional help, hope, and healing to all who are grieving the death of a loved one in military service to America, regardless of relationship to the deceased, geography, or circumstance of the death. TAPS meets its mission by providing peer-based support, crisis care, casework assistance, seminars for adults, Good Grief Camps for children, and grief and trauma resources.
The Tragedy Assistance Program for Survivors (TAPS) provides a wonderful support network for the surviving families of those who have died in service to America.
To stay up to date on our latest activities, please become a fan of TAPS on Facebook at: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Tragedy-Assistance-Program-for-Survivors-TAPS/108008237990?ref=ts
TAPS offers care and support for the military family experiencing a casualty. Please call on us to help any time 24-hours a day: 1-800-959-TAPS or visit http://www.taps.org/
1. We provide comfort and care to everyone grieving the death of someone who served in the military.
2. We provide good grief camps for children, seminar for adults, grief and trauma resources, peer mentoring, and casework assistance.
cause.mission: TAPS is a national non-profit organization serving families, friends, and military service members affected by an active-duty military death.
cause.name: Support TAPS (Tragedy Assistance Program for Survivors)
